title: For Sale:  Hazen Knives PUFF ADDER with Micarta Handle and Nylon Sheath
location: Charlotte, 4724 Old Pineville Rd., Charlotte, North Carolina
postcontent: Brand New Model!! USA made in Monroe, NC. 100% handmade, no jigs used, real artisan knife making, no two knives are ever the same. The edges can easily shave the hair off the hairiest person you know. Help support a great local knife maker with your purchase. STANDARD KNIFE SPECIFICATIONSOverall length - 13 1/2"Blade material - 1095 High Carbon steelBlade finish - Black Power CoatBlade length - 7 1/4"Blade width - 2" (widest part)Handle - 5 3/4"Handle material - Black Canvass MicartaHandle bolts - Black stainless steel screwsSheath - Black Ballistic Nylon In August of 1976, Mark Hazen started his career as a custom knife maker. At that time, he could not afford to purchase a custom knife, so he decided to make his own. That's when it all began. Initially, Mark made knives for his friends and eventually, his creative talent was sought after by customers throughout the USA. After 30 years as a renowned knife maker, Mark decided to retire in 2007. On September 23, 2013, he received a call from Colonel Jack Tobin, president of The Special Forces Association at Fort Bragg, NC. While at an estate auction preview, Colonel Tobin saw a knife which he felt would be perfect for Special Forces active duty personnel, as well as the members of the association. Mark came out of retirement and began his journey by making a knife in honor of his fallen friend, MSG Robert Horrigan, a Special Forces Operator stationed at Fort Bragg, NC.Mark Hazen, who mastered the art of knife making over the past 30 years, is reintroducing classic old world craftsmanship in new and innovative designs. Each knife is hand made without the use of jigs. The blade and edge geometry has been engineered into each model to ensure optimum performance for its intended use. The ergonomically designed handles are specifically contoured to give a comfortable and confident grip. Each Hazen knife is uniquely crafted and well suited for all military and law enforcement personnel, sportsmen and the discriminating collector.All the knives produced at Hazen Knives go through a 3-phase testing process to ensure that each knife meets uncompromising quality standards. Each batch of steel is tested since all are not exactly the same. One knife is made from each new batch and is rigorously tested by chopping through a 2X4 piece of lumber and cleanly slicing through a piece of 20 lb. paper. If the hardness and edge retention meet the standards of phase one, the cutting test, then the testing continues to phase two, the comfort test and phase three, the fit and finish test.Come check this knife out in person at The Arms Room in Charlotte. Give me a call @ 980-237-eight9eight1 if you have any questions. Shipping can be arranged for $10. Check us out on Facebook @ www.facebook.com/thearmsroomcharlotte or try our website @ www.targuns.com Thanks for looking and have a good day. Trades are always welcome.

title: For Sale:  Hazen Knives TROLL with Micarta Handle and Nylon Sheath
location: 5800 South Boulevard Charlotte, NC 28217, Charlotte, North Carolina
postcontent: Brand New Model!! USA made in Monroe, NC. 100% handmade, no jigs used, real artisan knife making, no two knives are ever the same. The edges can easily shave the hair off the hairiest person you know. Help support a great local knife maker with your purchase. STANDARD KNIFE SPECIFICATIONSOverall length - 11 1/2"Blade material - 1095 High Carbon steelBlade finish - Black Powder CoatBlade length - 6 1/2"Blade width - 1 1/2" (widest part)Handle - 5"Handle material - Black Canvas MicartaHandle bolts - Black stainless steel screwsSheath - Black Ballistic Nylon In August of 1976, Mark Hazen started his career as a custom knife maker. At that time, he could not afford to purchase a custom knife, so he decided to make his own. That's when it all began. Initially, Mark made knives for his friends and eventually, his creative talent was sought after by customers throughout the USA. After 30 years as a renowned knife maker, Mark decided to retire in 2007. On September 23, 2013, he received a call from Colonel Jack Tobin, president of The Special Forces Association at Fort Bragg, NC. While at an estate auction preview, Colonel Tobin saw a knife which he felt would be perfect for Special Forces active duty personnel, as well as the members of the association. Mark came out of retirement and began his journey by making a knife in honor of his fallen friend, MSG Robert Horrigan, a Special Forces Operator stationed at Fort Bragg, NC.Mark Hazen, who mastered the art of knife making over the past 30 years, is reintroducing classic old world craftsmanship in new and innovative designs. Each knife is hand made without the use of jigs. The blade and edge geometry has been engineered into each model to ensure optimum performance for its intended use. The ergonomically designed handles are specifically contoured to give a comfortable and confident grip. Each Hazen knife is uniquely crafted and well suited for all military and law enforcement personnel, sportsmen and the discriminating collector.All the knives produced at Hazen Knives go through a 3-phase testing process to ensure that each knife meets uncompromising quality standards. Each batch of steel is tested since all are not exactly the same. One knife is made from each new batch and is rigorously tested by chopping through a 2X4 piece of lumber and cleanly slicing through a piece of 20 lb. paper. If the hardness and edge retention meet the standards of phase one, the cutting test, then the testing continues to phase two, the comfort test and phase three, the fit and finish test.Come check this knife out in person at The Arms Room in Charlotte. Give me a call @ 980-237-eight9eight1 if you have any questions. Shipping can be arranged for $10. Check us out on Facebook @ www.facebook.com/thearmsroomcharlotte or try our website @ www.targuns.com Thanks for looking and have a good day. Trades are always welcome.

title: For Sale:  Desert Eagle, .50 AE, Stainless w Muzzle Brake, 4 Mags & 200 Rnds 300 Gr Ammo – New in box
location: Greenville, TX e of Dallas. I30 @ 93mile, East Texas, Texas
postcontent:
I am a 71 year old disabled Vietnam era veteran of the United States Marine Corps and a former deputy with Rockwall and Hunt County Sheriffs Office.  I have a strong regard for a Stainless Steel construction (I believe this to be the 1st time Desert Eagle available in Stainless Steel construction) and I naively purchased this weapon sight unseen.  This particular model features a Muzzle Brake as an integrated feature, designed and built into the pistol at the time of  manufacture.

I believe that the Integrated Muzzle Brake promises to offer substantially enhanced weapon control to a gimpy old fart with lose of strength and muscle mass.  However I was not prepared for the “shock and awe” when this little hummer arrived and the gun case was opened for the first time.  This was a couple of clicks from a cardiac-arrest moment for me!  This is a large weapon in my view…

This pistol remains unfired and in the manufacturers shipping packaging and has only been mauled and groped once or twice by an unbelieving buyer.  Instead, I have decided to purchase some hot loads for my old faithful and trusty Left Handed Randall 45 Caliber 1911A1 and to sell the Desert Eagle, .50 AE Caliber Hand Cannon with all of the extras I purchased prior to taking delivery thrown in!

As I reside in Texas, I can deliver face to face to a buyer with valid DL, Texas or other.  If your state does not have standing law prohibiting anyone from delivering a handgun to any person that I have reasonable cause to believe has not been convicted of a crime of violence, is a drug addict, a habitual drunkard, or of unsound mind, I will ship to your location at your expense.

Shipping expenses paid by the buyer will be at my cost.   I can also ship to an FFL agent of your choosing.

In consummating this transaction, I am not anxious to meet up with a shady character in a dark alley on a cold rainy night.  I plan to avoid a dark alley scenario like the plague!

title: For Sale:  NEW Smith & Wesson M&P Shield 9mm
postcontent: You are looking at a brand new S&W Shield chambered in 9mm or 40sw. Smith & Wesson’s M&P SHIELD is a slim, concealable, lightweight, striker-fired polymer pistol. The M&P SHIELD features a slim design combined with the proven and trusted features found in the M&P Pistol Series. From the pistol’s easily concealed one-inch profile to its optimized 18-degree grip angle, the M&P SHIELD offers professional-grade features that provide simple operation and reliable performance. The M&P SHIELD features a high-strength polymer frame with a black, durable, corrosion resistant finish, coated stainless steel slide and barrel. Both models are standard with a 3.1-inch barrel, which contributes to an overall length of 6.1 inches and an unloaded weight of 19 ounces. For fast tracking and smooth target acquisition, the M&P SHIELD is standard with a 5.3-inch sight radius and has been enhanced with a short, consistent trigger pull measuring 6.5 pounds. Featuring a quick and audible reset made possible by the striker-fired action, the M&P SHIELD allows multiple rounds to be placed on target both consistently and accurately. ALL BACKED BY SMITH & WESSON'S LIFETIME SERVICE POLICY.

title: For Sale:  NEW CZ 75D COMPACT PCR ALLOY FRAME 9MM 91194
postcontent: The PCR name stands for ‘Police Czech Republic,’ the group for whom the model was originally designed. Nearly identical in size to the CZ 75 Compact, it weighs in at a full 1/4 pound lighter owing to its forged aluminum frame, making it more comfortable for everyday carry.Equipped with a decocking lever, the PCR is designed to be decocked before holstering. After decocking, the trigger safety is much like that of a double action revolver. While there is no need to flip a safety lever off, the relatively longer and heavier trigger pull for the first round requires the conscious decision to pull the trigger before firing. Other additions to the PCR include rubber grip panels, serrated front and back straps for improved handling and a loaded chamber indicator.

title: For Sale:  Gaclo Pocket Holster for Ruger LCP, KelTec, P3AT, P32
postcontent:
I purchased this new last year for my Ruger LCP.  I've using other equipment and getting rid of this.  I barely used it so it is like new condition.

Cash only please.  Not looking for trades.

Copying from the mfg info:

RUGER LCP, KelTec P3AT,P32

 The Pocket Protector holster is designed for front pocket carry in pants or a jacket. The Pocket Protector keeps the firearm in the same general position so you can quickly locate the grip when you need to draw, conceals the shape of the gun so that its outline is not printed through the pants, and allows one-handed release of gun from both pocket and holster. Reinforcements at the holster mouth and beneath the trigger guard keep the holster stiff enough to allow a smooth draw and easy return to the holster, while also maintaining enough rigidity to prevent “printing” and shifting of the handgun. The holster’s hooked shape – at the base of the handgun’s trigger guard – is designed to catch on the pocket so that, with practice (using an unloaded firearm) and while using the proper pants, you can draw the firearm while the holster remains in your pocket or falls away. The Pocket Protector is ambidextrous and constructed of premium Center Cut Steerhide.

title: For Sale:  Bison Armory/WOA/Daniel Defense/Yankee Hill 6.8 SPC II Complete Custom Upper
postcontent:
***Armslist will only let me upload 3 pictures. If you text me at REDACTED, I can provide a number of other photos.***

I have for sale a serious upper today. I do not want to sell it, but I am in need of some cash. This is an AR complete upper receiver chambered in 6.8 SPC II. This caliber is quite possibly the best deer/hog hunting caliber out of the AR platform today. 300 Blackout doesn't even come close to the terminal performance and effective range of the 6.8. With proper ammunition, this cartridge is a 400 yard deer gun in a handy AR sized package.
     I built this upper with all top quality, tier one parts. The barrel is a Bison Armory stainless steel, 1:11 twist, 16 inch, with black Cerakote applied for maximum durability. This barrel is ridiculously accurate. Easily 3/4-1/2 MOA. it has a midlength gas system and M4 feed ramps. The upper is also a Bison forged. 
     The bolt carrier is  White Oak Armory, and is very clean. Chromed internals, like it should be. The bolt is Daniel Defense; MP/Shot Peened 6.8, so you know it's quality. 
The standard extractor spring has been replaced with a BCM 4-coil enhanced chrome-silicon spring. No FTE's here. It also has a standard mil-spec charging handle. 
     The handguard is a Yankee Hill; Todd Jarret edition, 12 inch version. It has been coated in Magpul OD Green Cerakote for durability and aesthetics. 
     On the muzzle is a Troy Claymore muzzle brake, that does a nice job of reducing recoil and directing the blast forward, away from the shooter. 
     In addition, the upper is outfitted with a set of the rugged Magpul BUIS. The front sight post has been replaced with a more narrow version from KNS for unequaled iron sight accuracy. 
With the upper the buyer will receive one C-Products stainless steel 25-round magazine and a 20 round box of Hornady 6.8 120 Grain SST ammunition. This round packs a serious punch.

I believe the price is fair for what this upper is capable of. I have put around 120 rounds through it to see how it shot and I was very impressed. Everything has been cleaned and oiled with Slip 2000 EWL. Don't be outgunned in the woods on your next deer/hog/coyote hunt. Step up to the 6.8 SPC. 
     I would be open to trades, with the exception that I would like a minimum of $700 cash along with a trade offer. 

Thanks for looking!
